page.title: 11EAGLEY MILLS
page.content: Eagley Mills was built about 150 years ago,next to Eagley Brook.Eagley Mills was owned by a large manufacturing cotton firm call J.P.Coats.The mills were built next to Eagley Brook in order to provide the damp conditions needed for dyeing and bleaching cloth. At Eagley Mills they spun and manufactured sewing cotton.Near the mill a school,cottages and a church were built for the workers.In the mill children and adults worked very long hours. After the war it was sold to a firm and the mill was split up into smaller units and leased out to a variety of smaller businesses as the accomodation was cheap and plentiful.Now different companies work there e.g.a mail order firm,a keep fit studio,light engineering works,a company which designs needlework kits and others.
